intro: Microseris tenuicula, commonly known as slenderleaf tansy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, also known as the mustard family, and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and delicate, linear leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds. Microseris tenuicula is often found in disturbed areas and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
